One Level Up Top Level

replication/syncrep_gram.y - pgsql17devel-backend

  1. %{
  2. /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3. *
  4. * syncrep_gram.y                - Parser for synchronous_standby_names
  5. *
  6. * Portions Copyright (c) 1996-2024, PostgreSQL Global Development Group
  7. * Portions Copyright (c) 1994, Regents of the University of California
  8. *
  9. *
  10. * IDENTIFICATION
  11. *      src/backend/replication/syncrep_gram.y
  12. *
  13. *-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  14. */
  15. #include "postgres.h"

  17. #include "nodes/pg_list.h"
  18. #include "replication/syncrep.h"

  20. /* Result of parsing is returned in one of these two variables */
  21. SyncRepConfigData *syncrep_parse_result;
  22. char       *syncrep_parse_error_msg;

  24. static SyncRepConfigData *create_syncrep_config(const char *num_sync,
  25.                     List *members, uint8 syncrep_method);

  27. /*
  28. * Bison doesn't allocate anything that needs to live across parser calls,
  29. * so we can easily have it use palloc instead of malloc.  This prevents
  30. * memory leaks if we error out during parsing.
  31. */
  32. #define YYMALLOC palloc
  33. #define YYFREE   pfree

  35. %}

  37. %expect 0
  38. %name-prefix="syncrep_yy"

  40. %union
  41. {
  42.     char       *str;
  43.     List       *list;
  44.     SyncRepConfigData *config;
  45. }

  47. %token <str> NAME NUM JUNK ANY FIRST

  49. %type <config> result standby_config
  50. %type <list> standby_list
  51. %type <str> standby_name

  53. %start result

  55. %%
  56. result:
  57.         standby_config                { syncrep_parse_result = $1; }
  58.     ;

  60. standby_config:
  61.         standby_list                { $$ = create_syncrep_config("1", $1, SYNC_REP_PRIORITY); }
  62.         | NUM '(' standby_list ')'        { $$ = create_syncrep_config($1, $3, SYNC_REP_PRIORITY); }
  63.         | ANY NUM '(' standby_list ')'        { $$ = create_syncrep_config($2, $4, SYNC_REP_QUORUM); }
  64.         | FIRST NUM '(' standby_list ')'        { $$ = create_syncrep_config($2, $4, SYNC_REP_PRIORITY); }
  65.     ;

  67. standby_list:
  68.         standby_name                        { $$ = list_make1($1); }
  69.         | standby_list ',' standby_name        { $$ = lappend($1, $3); }
  70.     ;

  72. standby_name:
  73.         NAME                        { $$ = $1; }
  74.         | NUM                        { $$ = $1; }
  75.     ;
  76. %%

  78. static SyncRepConfigData *
  79. create_syncrep_config(const char *num_sync, List *members, uint8 syncrep_method)
  80. {
  81.     SyncRepConfigData *config;
  82.     int            size;
  83.     ListCell   *lc;
  84.     char       *ptr;

  86.     /* Compute space needed for flat representation */
  87.     size = offsetof(SyncRepConfigData, member_names);
  88.     foreach(lc, members)
  89.     {
  90.         char       *standby_name = (char *) lfirst(lc);

  92.         size += strlen(standby_name) + 1;
  93.     }

  95.     /* And transform the data into flat representation */
  96.     config = (SyncRepConfigData *) palloc(size);

  98.     config->config_size = size;
  99.     config->num_sync = atoi(num_sync);
  100.     config->syncrep_method = syncrep_method;
  101.     config->nmembers = list_length(members);
  102.     ptr = config->member_names;
  103.     foreach(lc, members)
  104.     {
  105.         char       *standby_name = (char *) lfirst(lc);

  107.         strcpy(ptr, standby_name);
  108.         ptr += strlen(standby_name) + 1;
  109.     }

  111.     return config;
  112. }
